column3: Why hello. You're a familiar, yes? And you've come alone to survey the grounds of Elpis, have you? Very good. Well, if you've any pressing questions, do let me know. I will do my best to answer them.
What kind of place is this?
You want to know about me? How thoughtful. I am a taxonomist employed here at Poieten Oikos, responsible for bequeathing the creations that pass through Elpis with logical─yet mellifluous─names.

Mine is marvelous work─I oft spend my days composing inspiring verses about flora and fauna. Some find these methods odd, I know...but the well of taxonomic creativity dries up rather quickly once you've seen twelve renditions of the same concept in different skins, let me tell you.
This is Poieten Oikos, a place where great minds come together to not only evaluate concepts, but supply them with names.

You might be wondering what the name of the place itself means, to which I say─many things! However, “home of those who've a way with words” is likely the easiest for you to understand. We taxonomists express ourselves through nomenclature, after all.
